page.title: 15THE PARISH CHURCH,VENTNOR.
page.content: St. Catherine's is the parish church of Ventnor. It was consecrated in 1837. John Hamborough provided the money. The church seats 196 people and has a gallery. In recent years the church hall was sold and a side aisle converted into a hall. The church originally had a spire a-top a tower but it was removed because of earth movements. This year the pinnacles were removed as well. The Vicar of Ventnor is The Rev. Malcolm Pickering. During the winter approx. 60 people attend the Sunday Service but this can rise to 80 in the summer. The church gives 10% of the previous year's income to charities. The church has a number of clubs for all age-groups. St. Boniface School is attached to St. Catherine's Church.
